headline: Saudi Arabia Marketing and Advertising Agency Market Analysis, Industry Trends & Growth Forecasts 2025-2030, with Creative Waves, Advertising Ways, WPP, Omnicom, Accenture Song, Dentsu KSA, and more
summary: The Saudi Arabia Marketing and Advertising Agency Market is projected to grow from USD 2.39 billion in 2025 to USD 3.14 billion by 2030, driven by digital transformation and increased advertising spend. Saudi Vision 2030 boosts demand for specialized marketing services. Riyadh is a key growth hub due to influencer marketing and digital engagement. Major industry players include Creative Waves and VML. Challenges include low outsourcing awareness among smaller firms.Dublin, July 22, 2025 (GLOBE N

headline: Ad firm Interpublic beats quarterly estimates on resilient client spending
summary: The results are the latest sign that ad spending is holding firm in an uncertain economy, after French ad giant Publicis and Omnicom also reported upbeat earnings.  Interpublic benefited in the April-June quarter from strong spending from its media and healthcare-focused businesses, as well as growth in its sports marketing and public relations units, CEO Philippe Krakowsky said.  The company, which last year signed a $13.25 billion merger with Omnicom to create the world's largest ad agency and better navigate the changing industry landscape, also said it expects the deal to close in the second half of the year.

headline: Omnicom Group’s Q2 Earnings Call: Our Top 5 Analyst Questions
summary: Omnicom Group’s first quarter results for 2025 were met with a notably negative market response, as the stock declined sharply despite the company meeting revenue expectations and delivering a non-GAAP profit above analyst estimates. Management cited steady performance in media, advertising, and precision marketing, but also acknowledged ongoing challenges in public relations, healthcare, and branding. headline: Omnicom Announces Formation of Omnicom Oceania, Appoints Nick Garrett as CEO
summary: Omnicom (NYSE: OMC) today announced the formation of Omnicom Oceania. The move aligns all Omnicom's practice areas across Australia and New Zealand including market leading media and creative agencies, PR, performance marketing, production and more under a unified leadership structure.
